title: UK military life captured through the tender eyes of the forces' children
text:
Many children of armed forces personnel still can't see their parents for long periods of time, Little Troops charity says

The look of love in these pictures of tearful partings and joyful reunions ­between ­children and their military parents is ­captured for a charity 2020 calendar.

It’s been five years since our troops came home from Afghanistan but many children of armed forces personnel still have to wave their serving parents goodbye for long periods of time.

These include little Jasper Joseph, who was pictured at 14 days old in a warm embrace with his dad.

In another cute picture, two-year-old Harry Sharkey, of Portsmouth, Hampshire, looks for his daddy's ship at the dockland.

The Little Troops charity, which helps services families cope with missing their loved ones, has put together a series of moving images to celebrate these moments.

The Military Moments 2020 calender is on sale now, costing £7.50. All proceeds help Little Troopers to continue providing fundamental resources and initiatives to support military children such as the Little Troopers Treasures storytime app and Little Troopers Separation Pack
